result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott R. LaPean was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**3 days jail credit, if revoked**
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

AODA and follow through with recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott R. LaPean

records.addlTxt: Judgment for unpaid fine/forfeiture/other not sent; no current address.
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

(Case called at 9:00 AM) Defendant Scott R. LaPean in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Scott R. LaPean.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense recites the joint sentence recommendation. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1- Possession of Methamphetamine as Repeater. Defendant acknowledges prior convictions. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. Defendant makes a statement. 
Court withholds sentence and orders 2 years Probation with the following conditions: 60 days jail with Huber or Electronic Monitoring privileges if available, all stayed pending further order of the court; AODA and follow through with recommendations; No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting; Maintain absolute sobriety; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. Court orders 3 days credit, if revoked. Court makes statements.
Plea hearing on June 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
